original: Ehrensvärd, Gösta Carl Albert, greve, konteramiral, Karlskrona, f. 10/2/ 85 i Skabersjö, Malmöh. 1., av amiralen, greve Carl Aug. E. o. frih :an Ulla Thott. G. 09 m. Anna Enell. Barn: Gösta f. 10, fil. dr, g. m. Inga-Lill Rydh, Carl August 13, kapt. v. filo’ttan, g. m. Eva Morddng, Ulilia 18, g. m. kapt. G. Murray. — Sjö-kadett 98, sjöoff:ex. 04, KSHS 08- 09, KSHS hk 10-11. Und itöjtn. v. flottan 04, löjtn. 06, kapt. 13, kom-mendörkapt. 22, kommendör 33, kon-teramiral 38. Lär v. KSHS 18-22, chef f. jagrdiv. 19 o. 23-24, f. marinstab. kommunik :avd. 27-29, å pansarskepp. Oscar II 29, f. marinstab. operationsavd. 29-32, å pansarskeppet Drottn. Victoria 32-33, flaggkapt. i chef. f. kustflottan stab 33-36, chef f. marinstab. 37-39, f. kns-tflottan 39-42, befälh. amiral o. chef f. Sydkustens marindis’tr. sed. 42. Led. av 30 års för.siv :kiomim. 30-32. Re-d. f. Tidsikr. i Sjöväsendet 25-27. KmstkSO, RNO, RVO, KDDOlgr, KFinlVRO, KNS :t-OO, KPoilRest2kl, KSpMerNavOlkl, RLtiKrO, RRS :itSit03kl, TM04 kil, SV-KGM, Danisik FrM, LKrVA, HedLÖS.
translated:
Ehrensvärd, Gösta Carl Albert, Count, Rear Admiral, Karlskrona, b. February 10, 1885 in Skabersjö, Malmöhus. First child of Admiral, Count Carl August Ehrensvärd and Baroness Ulla Thott. Married in 1909 to Anna Enell. Children: Gösta, born in 1910, PhD, married to Inga-Lill Rydh; Carl August, born in 1913, Captain of Fleet, married to Eva Morddng; Ulilia, born in 1918, married to Captain G. Murray. 

He began his naval career as a naval cadet in 1898, passed the naval officer exam in 1904, attended the Royal Naval Staff College from 1908 to 1909, and attended the college as a student from 1910 to 1911. He was promoted to Sub-Lieutenant in the Navy in 1904, to Lieutenant in 1906, to Captain in 1913, to Commander in 1922, to Captain of Fleet in 1933, and to Rear Admiral in 1938. 

He was a lecturer at the Royal Naval Staff College from 1918 to 1922, commander of the hunting division in 1919 and 1923-1924, head of the communication department at the naval staff from 1927 to 1929, served on the battleship Oscar II in 1929, head of the operations department of the naval staff from 1929 to 1932, served on the battleship Drottning Victoria from 1932 to 1933, flag captain in 1933-1936 for the commander of the coastal fleet staff, head of the naval staff in 1937-1939, commander of the navy in 1939-1942, and commander and head of the Southern Coast Navy District from 1942 onwards. 

He was a member of the 30-year defense commission from 1930 to 1932, editor of the magazine "Tidskrift i Sjöväsendet" from 1925 to 1927, and held several orders and decorations including KmstkSO, RNO, RVO, KDDOlgr, KFinlVRO, KNS:t-OO, KPolRest2kl, KSpMerNavOlkl, RLtiKrO, RRS:itSit03kl, TM04 kil, SV-KGM, Danisik FrM, LKrVA, HedLÖS.

structured.name: Gösta Carl Albert Ehrensvärd
jobTitle: Head of the communication department at the naval staff
Flag captain for the commander of the coastal fleet staff
